<!-- WARNING: this file was generated by Pulumi Docs Generator. -->
<!-- Do not edit by hand unless you're certain you know what you are doing! -->

Use this data source to retrieve the list of groups assigned to the given Okta application (by ID).


{{% examples %}}

## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}





{{< example csharp >}}

```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Okta = Pulumi.Okta;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var test = Output.Create(Okta.GetAppGroupAssignments.InvokeAsync(new Okta.GetAppGroupAssignmentsArgs
        {
            Id = okta_app_oauth.Test.Id,
        }));
    }

}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example go >}}

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-okta/sdk/v3/go/okta"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := okta.LookupAppGroupAssignments(ctx, &GetAppGroupAssignmentsArgs{
			Id: okta_app_oauth.Test.Id,
		}, nil)
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example python >}}

```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_okta as okta

test = okta.get_app_group_assignments(id=okta_app_oauth["test"]["id"])
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example typescript >}}


```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as okta from "@pulumi/okta";

const test = okta.getAppGroupAssignments({
    id: okta_app_oauth.test.id,
});
```
